Sentencas: Electrochemical reduction of carbon dioxide in the intermediate temperature region was investigated by utilizing a reversible solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC).
Titulo: High-efficiency intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolyzer cells for the conversion of carbon dioxide to fuels

Sentencas: The current potential (i-V) curve exhibited a nonlinear characteristic at low current density.
Titulo: High-efficiency intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolyzer cells for the conversion of carbon dioxide to fuels

Sentencas: Differentiation of i-V curves revealed that the cell area specific resistance (ASR) was current-dependent and had its maximum in electrolysis mode and minimum in fuel cell mode.
Titulo: High-efficiency intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolyzer cells for the conversion of carbon dioxide to fuels

Sentencas: Impedance measurements were performed under different current densities and gas compositions, and the results were analyzed by calculating the distribution of relaxation times.
Titulo: High-efficiency intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolyzer cells for the conversion of carbon dioxide to fuels

Sentencas: The ASR variation resulted from the difference in electrochemical reactions occurring on the Ni-YSZ electrode, i.e., Ni-YSZ is a better electrode for CO oxidation than for CO2 reduction.
Titulo: High-efficiency intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolyzer cells for the conversion of carbon dioxide to fuels

Sentencas: Coke formation on Ni-YSZ played a crucial role in affecting its electrolysis performance in the intermediate temperature region.
Titulo: High-efficiency intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolyzer cells for the conversion of carbon dioxide to fuels

Sentencas: The ASR apex was associated with a decrease in cell temperature during electrolysis due to the endothermic nature of CO2 reduction reaction.
Titulo: High-efficiency intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolyzer cells for the conversion of carbon dioxide to fuels

Sentencas: It was postulated that such a decrease in temperature and rise in CO concentration led to coke formation.
Titulo: High-efficiency intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolyzer cells for the conversion of carbon dioxide to fuels

Sentencas: As a consequence, higher temperature (>700 degrees C), higher CO2 concentration (>50%), and the presence of hydrogen or steam are recommended for efficient CO2 reduction in solid oxide electrochemical cells.
Titulo: High-efficiency intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolyzer cells for the conversion of carbon dioxide to fuels
